docs.title: Velvet Language Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for the Velvet Programming Language.

docs.title: 1) Installing Velvet
docs.text:
Prerequisite Notice

To build Velvet from source, you need to install LLVM on your system.

Currently, the only way to run Velvet is to build it from source. Executables are not provided.

docs.title: Function print
docs.text:
print(arg as *) -> void

Prints a string argument to the standard output.

docs.title: Errors
docs.text:
Errors if writing to the stdout or flushing fails.

internal rust::vel_print

docs.title: Function write
docs.text:
write(arg as *) -> void

Prints a string argument to the standard output. Similar to the print function, however this function prints without a newline.

This method will automatically flush stdout when done processing. For behavior that does not flush, see write_nf.

docs.title: Errors
docs.text:
Errors if writing to the stdout or flushing fails.

internal rust::vel_write

docs.title: Function write_nf
docs.text:
write_nf(arg as *) -> void

Similar to the write function, but does not flush the standard output.

docs.title: Errors
docs.text:
Errors if writing to the stdout fails.

internal rust::vel_write_no_flush

docs.title: Function pow
docs.text:
pow(x as number, y as number) -> number

Returns the power of two numbers.
